definition:
A ring $R$ is *semi-local* if $R/rad(R)$ is an Artinian ring, where
$rad(R)$ denotes the Jacobson radical of $R$. In the case that $R$ is
commutative, this reduces to the definition that $R$ is *semi-local* if
$R$ has finitely many maximal ideals. Note that finite rings are
trivially semi-local.
